commands.heading: What is Flexbox?
commands.description: Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout method for arranging items in rows or columns.

commands.heading: Why Use Flexbox?
commands.description: Flexbox simplifies alignment, spacing, and responsive layouts

commands.heading: display
commands.description: Defines a flex container; inline or block context

commands.heading: flex-direction
commands.description: Specifies the direction of the flex items

commands.heading: flex-wrap
commands.description: Controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the new lines.

commands.heading: justify-content
commands.description: Aligns flex items along the main axis.

commands.heading: align-items
commands.description: Aligns flex items along the cross axis.

commands.heading: order
commands.description: Controls the order of flex items.

commands.heading: flex-grow
commands.description: Defines the ability for a flex item to grow if necessary.

commands.heading: flex-shrink
commands.description: Defines the ability for a flex item to shrink if necessary.

commands.heading: flex-basis
commands.description: Defines the default size of an element before the remaining space is distributed.

commands.heading: align-self
commands.description: Allows the default alignment (or the one specified by align-items) to be overridden for individual flex items.
